author: Special Correspondent
text:
Gujarat govt. reaches out to Patels agitating for quota benefits

A day after supporting the demand of the Patel community for reservation, Gujarat BJP MP and a leading Patel community leader Vitthal Radadiya on Tuesday met Hardik Patel in Surat jail to discuss the “compromise formula.”

The 22-year-old Hardik, who spearheaded a mass agitation demanding reservation benefits, has been in jail since last September facing two sedition cases slapped on him and his aides.

“I met Hardik on the CM's behalf to discuss the issue of reservation and how it can be resolved. We had a detailed discussion on all the issues related to the quota and demands raised by the Patidar Anamat Andolan Samiti,” Mr. Radadiya told media persons.

The MP indicated that the government was considering withdrawing the sedition cases against Hardik and his aides if the quota issue was mutually resolved. The government had withdrawn more than 70 cases involving over 300 Patels, who were arrested during the agitation.

Meanwhile, a BJP legislator from Surat, Kumar Kanani, also joined the chorus of BJP leaders supporting the community’s demand for quotas in jobs and education.

title: BJP MP meets Hardik, moots formula for compromise
